etymologies: late 17th century (denoting a catch in a clock): from French détente, from Old French destente, from destendre ‘slacken’, from des- (expressing reversal) + Latin tendere ‘to stretch’

definitions: a catch in a machine which prevents motion until released

examples.text: a system of detents is used to ensure that gears are held in whatever position is selected

shortDefinitions: catch in machine which prevents motion until released

definitions: (in a clock) a catch that regulates striking.
shortDefinitions: catch that regulates striking in clock
